result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Patrick Bauer

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order for Continuance of Competency Hearing
Competency Report attached to Cover sheet for Confidential Records
Competency hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:31 AM Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer appeared by zoom technology by video along Attorney Zebulon Patek by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. State has visited with Mr. Patek this morning and he has information he wishes to share with the Court.  Mr. Patek raises competency and requests an evaluation.  Court will order an evaluation and have a hearing after we have a report.  Court will waive TL for PH in 22CF34.  No objection by Atty Patek or Mr. Bauer.  22CF28 will track along with this case.  Mr. Patek asks the competency issue apply to all files.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cash bond is modified to $5000 signature bond until such point Mr. Bauer is no longer subject to be in another facility under the other proceeding and then the cash bond will automatically be reinstated and Mr. Bauer either pay the bond or be remanded to the custody of the Pepin County Sheriff.

12:45 PM 22CF34.  Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer appeared by video without counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  State has made a motion to modify the terms of the bond necessitated on the fact that you will now be involved in confidential proceedings, which for the moment will require you to be in another facility other than the Pepin County Jail.  State requests Mr. Bauer's cash bond be converted to a $5000 signature bond until such time as is he is no longer involved in the confidential proceedings and then be converted back to cash bond and returned to the Pepin County Jail in the criminal matter.  Mr. Bauer has no comments.  Court grants the State's motion at this time the cash bond is modified to $5000 signature bond until such point Mr. Bauer is no longer subject to being required to be in another facility under the other proceeding and then the cash bond will automatically be reinstated and Mr. Bauer either pay the bond or be remanded to the custody of the Pepin County Sheriff.  Court urges all parties involved to stay in contact to know the status of each matter.  The PH remains scheduled for 9/20 and urge Mr. Bauer to contact the PD office.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

12:44 PM Defendant Shawn Patrick Bauer appeared by zoom technology by video from the Pepin County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not yet contacted the PD.  Court advised defendant of charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  State, Mr. Bauer is a risk not to comply with law enforcement and ask for $5000 cash bond. Mr. Bauer asks for a signature bond and will be live with my mom and stay away from the farm.  On 8/26 you appeared in 22CF28 by phone and was given a court date of 9/6 at 1:30.  On 9/6 you FTA and gave no reason for your FTA.  In 22CF34 it is alleged you were driving, an officer tried to stop you with lights and siren and you would not stop.  You were speeding at 95 mph, struck squad car intentionally, continued being chased with lights and siren refusing to stop.  Court's opinion you are not willing to come to court and grant $5000 cash bond at request of the DA.  Court advised Mr. Bauer of right to PH within 10 days.  It will be unlikely if the PD office would be able to have you an attorney within the 10 days.  Do you wish your PH within the 10 days or WTL to have an attorney for your PH.  Mr. Bauer requests his PH within 10 days.  Court urges you to contact the PD office for representation.  If you do not qualify, Court would consider appointing counsel for you.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
